result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Af Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court sentences the defendant to "TIME SERVED".
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:24 pm
Defendant Adam Af Brown in court.

Court adjourned at 1:25 pm

10:00 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites agreement - upon plea to the Fail to report to jail, will recommend jail sentence and costs and upon plea to DC w/repeater and no DV, will recommend a fine and costs and count 1 will be dismissed and read-in.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2015CM186 and finds the defendant guilty on count 2 on 2015CM99 striking the DV enhancer and orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CM186

-TIME SERVED.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2015CM99 (DC)

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the $150 cash bond be applied to the fine and costs on 2015CM99.

Court adjourned at 10:12 a.m.
Status hearing on April 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Original Warrant has been received and destroyed
Status hearing on April 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.

9:30 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present via video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - requests an attorney and has contacted the PD's office.  Court sets for Status Hearing on April 26, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:32 a.m.
Bail / Bond - Defendant refused to sign bond

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Dave at GLSO.
43
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.
Status hearing on April 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

2:07 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  2015CM186 - Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 4, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.  Statement by the defendant.  Court uashes the warrants.

2015CM51 - FTP $443.00  Track with the other 2 cases.

Court adjourned at 2:11 p.m.
